title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 8.24 - Executive Order No. 24: Extending the Period for Paying School District Taxes in Certain School Districts Within the Counties of Broome, Delaware, Essex, Greene, Montgomery, Orange, Schenectady, Schoharie, Sullivan, Tioga, Ulster and Washington
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 8.24 - Executive Order No. 24: Extending the Period for Paying School District Taxes in Certain School Districts Within the Counties of Broome, Delaware, Essex, Greene, Montgomery, Orange, Schenectady, Schoharie, Sullivan, Tioga, Ulster and Washington

State Regulations
WHEREAS, beginning on August 27, 2011 and continuing
thereafter, Hurricane Irene and Tropical Storm Lee brought torrential rainfall
causing record flooding and storm surge throughout the State of New

York; WHEREAS, on September 19, 2011, as a result of the personal
hardships cuased by Hurricane Irene and Tropical Storm Lee, I issued Executive

Order No. 23, extending the period for paying without interest or penalty the
real property taxes that are due on or about September 30, 2011 in certain
school districts in the counties of Broome, Delaware, Essex, Greene, Hamilton, Orange, Schoharie, Tioga, Ulster and Washington; WHEREAS, since September 19, 2011, additional requests for
an extension of the period of paying school district taxes for 2011-2012 school
year have been received by the Governor's Office on behalf of the following
school districts within the below-listed counties: Broome: Harpursville Central School District, Maine-Endwell Central School District, Whitney Point Central School District and Windsor Central School District; Delaware: Margaretville Central School District and

Otego-Unadilla Central School District; Essex: Ausable Valley

Central School District; Greene: Cairo-Durham Central School

District and Windham-Ashland-Jewett Central School District; Montgomery: Fonda-Fultonville Central School District and Fort

Plain Central School District; Orange: Florida Union Free

School District, Highland Falls - Fort Montgomery Central School District, Tuxedo Central School District and Monroe-Woodbury Central School District; Schenectady: Duanesburg Central School District and Schalmont

Central School District; Schoharie: Gilboa-Conesville Central

School District and Middleburgh Central School District; Sullivan: Fallsburg Central School District, Monticello

Central School District and Sullivan-West Central School District; Tioga: Newark Valley Central School District, Owego-Apalachin

Central School District and Tioga Central School District; Ulster: Ellenville Central School District, Highland Central

School District, Rondout Valley Central School District and Walkill Central

School District; and

Washington: Salem Central School

District; WHEREAS, school district taxes for the 2011-2012 school
year are currently due on or about September 30, 2011 in the aforementioned
school districts; WHEREAS, section
925-a
of the Real Property Tax Law authorizes the Governor to extend the period for
paying such taxes without interest or penalty upon request of the chief
executive officer of an affected county, city, town, village or school district
during a State disaster emergency; WHEREAS, given the difficulties continuing to confront the
people of the afore-mentioned counties, such an extension is eminently
warranted; NOW, THEREFORE, I, Andrew M. Cuomo, Governor of the State
of New York, by virtue of the authority vested in me by section
925-a
of the Real Property Tax Law, do hereby extend the period for paying without
interest or penalty the school district taxes that are due on or about

September 30, 2011 in the afore-mentioned school districts within the above
listed counties for twenty-one days from the final date such taxes are
currently due; and
FURTHER, this Executive Order may be revised and amended to
extend the period for paying school taxes for school districts within the
counties adversely affected by Hurricane Irene or Tropical Storm Lee. Signed: Andrew M. Cuomo

Dated: September 29, 2011
